Subjects: epitaphs; Humphrey, duke of Gloucester; historical poems
_description: Epitaphium eiusdam Ducis Glowcestrie, A.D. 1447 — thirteen 8-line stanzas with refrain, ‘Have mercy on hym buryed in this sepulture’

BLHar2251.First Lines:
Souerayne Immortal everlastyng godAlmyghti most mercyful verray
                    well of grace…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…My sole to hym I yield at my goyng hensTo the erth my body as
                    for my sepulture
BLHar2251.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “An Epitaph for Duke Humphrey.” 
             Neuphilologische Mitteilunge
         56 (1955): 241-49: 243-7.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Historical Poems of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1959: 180-3.

BLAdd34360.First Lines:
Souerayne Immortal euerlastyng godAlmyghti most merciful verray
                    welle of grace…
BLAdd34360.Last Lines:
…My soule to hym I yield at my goyng hensTo the erth my body
                    as for my sepulture
